test_case_1.Subject: question on size_t
test_case_1.body: Hi chris, in lectre 5 the strcat() function contins size_t datatype. Does it need to be pre defined or simply integer values?

test_case_2.Subject: about sifs_mkvolume.c
test_case_2.body: Hi Chris, Sorry if its a dumb question to ask. But I couldn't figure out how the sifs_mkvolume.c has never used any function from the mkvolume.c in the library and still be able to create a new volume. It does check the integrity of the input parameters however that seems to have nothing to do with creating a new volume.

test_case_3.Subject: which mode to set file
test_case_3.body: If we wanted to change contents of the file with i.e. mkdir, would fopen() need to have mode r+ or w+ or something else?

test_case_4.Subject: segmentation fault
test_case_4.body: In dirinfo, we tried to define *entrynames = entries (which is array of entry names). But when we try to print elements of entryname out, it gives the segmentation error. Anyone know why this happens?

test_case_5.Subject: data block
test_case_5.body: i saw in one of the posts that volume is a file but not a text file so for example in every method along with the path of file or directory we are given with the path of volume so is it a directory?
